data.enText: do job/task

data.chText: 做体力（或脑力）工作；劳动；干活
data.enText: to do sth that involves physical or mental effort, especially as part of a job

data.chText: 我要是觉得冷就干不了活。
data.enText: I can't work if I'm cold.
I've been working at my assignment all day.
He is working on a new novel.
She's outside, working on the car.
Doctors often work very long hours.
to have a job
Both my parents work.

data.chText: 她在一家工程公司工作。
data.enText: She works for an engineering company.
I've always worked in education.
Do you enjoy working with children?
My son is working as a teacher.
make effort

data.chText: 使工作；（尤指）使卖力干活
data.enText: to make yourself/sb work, especially very hard

data.chText: 她工作起来太不辞劳苦了。
data.enText: She works herself too hard.
to make efforts to achieve sth

data.chText: 她为争取和平奉献了自己的一生。
data.enText: She dedicated her life to working for peace.

data.chText: 委员会正在设法营救那些被监禁的人出狱。
data.enText: The committee is working to get the prisoners freed.
manage
to manage or operate sth to gain benefit from it
to work the land (= grow crops on it, etc.)

data.chText: 他负责一个大地区的工作。
data.enText: He works a large area (= selling a company's goods, etc.) .

data.chText: 她是个很有技巧的演讲者，善于感召听众。
data.enText: She was a skilful speaker who knew how to work a crowd (= to excite them or make them feel sth strongly) .
machine/device
to function; to operate
The phone isn't working.
It works by electricity.

data.chText: 他们对大脑功能的了解有进展吗？
data.enText: Are they any closer to understanding how the brain works?

data.chText: 开动，操作（机器、装置等）；使运作
data.enText: to make a machine, device, etc. operate
Do you know how to work the coffee machine?

data.chText: 这台机器是以风力推动的。
data.enText: The machine is worked by wind power.
have result/effect

data.chText: 奏效；产生预期的结果（或作用）
data.enText: to have the result or effect that you want

data.chText: 医生给我的药片不管事。
data.enText: The pills the doctor gave me aren't working.

data.chText: 我的计划奏效了，我让他们同意了。
data.enText: My plan worked, and I got them to agree.
His charm doesn't work on me (= does not affect or impress me) .
to have a particular effect

data.chText: 你的年纪会妨碍你干这个工作。
data.enText: Your age can work against you in this job.

data.chText: 会说意大利语应对他有好处。
data.enText: Speaking Italian should work in his favour.

data.chText: 使奏效；（由于努力）造成，产生
data.enText: to cause or produce sth as a result of effort

data.chText: 你要是按照我们的家居装饰诀窍行事，可以用很少的钱就产生奇妙的效果。
data.enText: You can work miracles with very little money if you follow our home decoration tips.
use material

data.chText: （通过压挤、拉长、锤击等）使成形，使定形
data.enText: to make a material into a particular shape or form by pressing, stretching, hitting it, etc.
to work clay
to work gold
to work the mixture into a paste

data.chText: 用某种材料作画（或编制、编织等）
data.enText: to use a particular material to produce a picture or other item
an artist working in oils
a craftsman working with wool
of part of face/body
to move violently

data.chText: 他恐惧地盯着我，嘴在抽搐着。
data.enText: He stared at me in horror, his mouth working.
move gradually

data.chText: （逐渐地）移动（到某位置）；（逐步）变成（某状态）
data.enText: to move or pass to a particular place or state, usually gradually

data.chText: 这药得需要一段时间才能排出你的体外。
data.enText: It will take a while for the drug to work out of your system.

data.chText: 他一步一步努力，终于成为行业内的翘楚。
data.enText: He worked his way to the top of his profession.

data.chText: 我被捆绑起来，但设法挣脱了绳索。
data.enText: I was tied up, but managed to work myself free.
The screw had worked loose .

data.chText: 大多数含 work 的习语，都可在该等习语中的名词及形容词相关词条找到，如 work your fingers to the bone 在词条 finger 下。
data.enText: Most idioms containing work are at the entries for the nouns and adjectives in the idioms, for example work your fingers to the bone is at finger .
work it/things
to arrange sth in a particular way, especially by being clever

data.chText: 你能不能为我们搞到些免费票？
data.enText: Can you work it so that we get free tickets?
work around/round to sth/sb
to gradually turn a conversation towards a particular topic, subject, etc.

data.chText: 他东拉西扯了一会才绕到真正要说的事情上来。
data.enText: It was some time before he worked around to what he really wanted to say.
work at sth
to make great efforts to achieve sth or do sth well
He's working at losing weight.

data.chText: 学弹钢琴不容易，你非得下功夫不可。
data.enText: Learning to play the piano isn't easy. You have to work at it .
work sth in
work sth into sth
to try to include sth

data.chText: 难道你就不能在讲话中再增加几句笑话吗？
data.enText: Can't you work a few more jokes into your speech?
to add one substance to another and mix them together
Gradually work in the butter.
work sth↔off
to get rid of sth, especially a strong feeling, by using physical effort
She worked off her anger by going for a walk.
to earn money in order to be able to pay a debt

data.chText: 他们有一大笔银行贷款需要偿还。
data.enText: They had a large bank loan to work off.
work on sb

data.chText: 努力说服（使某人答应或做某事）
data.enText: to try to persuade sb to agree to sth or to do sth

data.chText: 他还没说他会做这事，不过我正在设法说服他。
data.enText: He hasn't said he'll do it yet, but I'm working on him.
work on sth
to try hard to improve or achieve sth

data.chText: 你需要再加把劲改进发音。
data.enText: You need to work on your pronunciation a bit more.

data.chText: “你找到临时看孩子的保姆了吗？”“还没有，我正在找呢。”
data.enText: ‘Have you sorted out a babysitter yet?’ ‘No, but I'm working on it .’
work out
to train the body by physical exercise

data.chText: 我经常做运动以保持健康。
data.enText: I work out regularly to keep fit.
to develop in a successful way

data.chText: 我的第一份工作干得不好。
data.enText: My first job didn't work out.

data.chText: 事情的结果对我们很不错。
data.enText: Things have worked out quite well for us.
work out (at sth)
if sth works out at sth, you calculate that it will be a particular amount

data.chText: 算来还是乘公共汽车便宜些。
data.enText: It'll work out cheaper to travel by bus.
work sb↔out
to understand sb's character

data.chText: 我从未能摸准她的秉性。
data.enText: I've never been able to work her out.
work sth↔out
to calculate sth
to work out the answer
to find the answer to sth
to work out a problem

data.chText: 你能辨认出这些潦草的字迹是什么意思吗？
data.enText: Can you work out what these squiggles mean?

data.chText: 我弄不清这音乐是从哪里传来的。
data.enText: I couldn't work out where the music was coming from.
to plan or think of sth

data.chText: 我想出了做这事的一个新方法。
data.enText: I've worked out a new way of doing it.
to remove all the coal, minerals, etc. from a mine over a period of time
a worked-out silver mine
work sb↔over
to attack sb and hit them, for example to make them give you information
work to sth

data.chText: 按照（计划、时间表等）；根据…行事
data.enText: to follow a plan, schedule, etc.
to work to a budget
We're working to a very tight deadline (= we have little time in which to do the work) .
work towards sth

data.chText: 努力达到，设法完成（目标）
data.enText: to try to reach or achieve a goal
work sth↔up
to develop or improve sth with some effort

data.chText: 我对他的想法怎么也热心不起来。
data.enText: I can't work up any enthusiasm for his idea.

data.chText: 她为了增加食欲散了很长时间的步。
data.enText: She went for a long walk to work up an appetite.
work sb/yourself up (into sth)
to make sb/yourself reach a state of great excitement, anger, etc.

data.chText: 别为此大动肝火。这不值得。
data.enText: Don't work yourself up into a state about it. It isn't worth it.

data.chText: 什么事使得你这么激动？
data.enText: What are you so worked up about?
work sth up into sth
to bring sth to a more complete or more acceptable state

data.chText: 我正在把我的笔记整理成一篇论文。
data.enText: I'm working my notes up into a dissertation.
work up to sth

data.chText: 逐步发展到，逐渐达到（更高或更深的程度）
data.enText: to develop or move gradually towards sth, usually sth more exciting or extreme

data.chText: 乐曲渐变到一个激动人心的末乐章。
data.enText: The music worked up to a rousing finale.

data.chText: 我开始在公园里慢跑，后来逐渐增加到一天跑五英里。
data.enText: I began by jogging in the park and worked up to running five miles a day.
job/task
the job that a person does especially in order to earn money
She had been out of work (= without a job) for a year.
They are in work (= have a job) .

data.chText: 他开始工作时做保安员。
data.enText: He started work as a security guard.

data.chText: 在目前这种经济大气候下很难找到工作。
data.enText: It is difficult to find work in the present economic climate.
I'm still looking for work.

data.chText: 她正计划孩子一入学就恢复上班。
data.enText: She's planning to return to work once the children start school.
What line of work are you in (= what type of work do you do) ?
before/after work (= in the morning/evening each day)

data.chText: 全日制 / 兼职 / 无报酬的 / 志愿工作
data.enText: full-time/part-time/unpaid/voluntary work
the duties that you have and the activities that you do as part of your job

data.chText: 警察的工作主要都是按常规的。
data.enText: Police work is mainly routine.

data.chText: 会计师向销售部的职员介绍了自己的职责。
data.enText: The accountant described his work to the sales staff.
tasks that need to be done
There is plenty of work to be done in the garden.
Taking care of a baby is hard work .
I have some work for you to do.

data.chText: 别说话了，继续干你们的活儿吧。
data.enText: Stop talking and get on with your work.

data.chText: 工作所需的材料（或档案等）
data.enText: materials needed or used for doing work , especially books, papers, etc.

data.chText: 她经常把办公室里的工作带回家。
data.enText: She often brings work (= for example, files and documents) home with her from the office.

data.chText: 他工作的材料摊了一地。
data.enText: His work was spread all over the floor.
place of job

data.chText: 工作地点；工作单位；工作场所
data.enText: the place where you do your job
I go to work at 8 o'clock.
When do you leave for work ?

data.chText: 这项新法规涉及工作场所的健康与安全。
data.enText: The new legislation concerns health and safety at work .
I have to leave work early today.

data.chText: 她工作单位的朋友来医院看望她。
data.enText: Her friends from work came to see her in the hospital.
effort
the use of physical strength or mental power in order to do or make sth

data.chText: 她的学习成绩完全是靠刻苦用功得来的。
data.enText: She earned her grades through sheer hard work .

data.chText: 我们于2002年开始干这个项目。
data.enText: We started work on the project in 2002.

data.chText: 修整这家旅馆的工作在继续。
data.enText: Work continues on renovating the hotel.

data.chText: 修建这座桥的工作用了六个月的时间。
data.enText: The work of building the bridge took six months.

data.chText: 收集艺术品是他一生的工作。
data.enText: The art collection was his life's work .
She set them to work painting the fence.
product of work
a thing or things that are produced as a result of work

data.chText: 她这位艺术家的作品令我赞赏不已。
data.enText: She's an artist whose work I really admire.

data.chText: 这件作品是你独立完成的吗？
data.enText: Is this all your own work (= did you do it without help from others) ?

data.chText: 这本书包括了这一学科的方方面面，是一部缜密翔实的大作。
data.enText: The book is a detailed and thorough piece of work covering all aspects of the subject.
result of action
the result of an action; what is done by sb

data.chText: 这毁损显然是些恣意破坏公物的人所为。
data.enText: The damage is clearly the work of vandals.
book/music/art
a book, piece of music, painting, etc.

data.chText: 托尔斯泰选集 / 全集
data.enText: the collected/complete works of Tolstoy
works of fiction/literature
Beethoven's piano works
building/repairing
activities involving building or repairing sth
roadworks

data.chText: 他们扩建造船厂，开始了工程施工。
data.enText: They expanded the shipyards and started engineering works.
factory
works

data.hoverText: 可与单数或复数动词连用的可数名词

data.enText: a place where things are made or industrial processes take place
an engineering works
a brickworks
parts of machine
the moving parts of a machine, etc.
everything
everything

data.chText: 我们去薯条店吃了套餐：炸鱼、炸薯条、小黄瓜、豆泥。
data.enText: We went to the chip shop and had the works: fish, chips, gherkins, mushy peas.
physics
the use of force to produce movement
all work and no play (makes Jack a dull boy)

data.chText: 只工作不玩耍，聪明的孩子也变傻
data.enText: it is not healthy to spend all your time working; you need to relax too
at work
having an effect on sth

data.chText: 她怀疑有些秘密势力在作祟。
data.enText: She suspected that secret influences were at work.
busy doing sth
He is still at work on the painting.
Danger─men at work.
get (down) to/set to work
to begin; to make a start

data.chText: 我们从屋子的外部开始干了起来。
data.enText: We set to work on the outside of the house (= for example, painting it) .
give sb the works
to give or tell sb everything
good works
kind acts to help others
go/set about your work

data.chText: 做（或着手做）自己的工作
data.enText: to do/start to do your work

data.chText: 她高高兴兴地做自己的工作。
data.enText: She went cheerfully about her work.
have your work cut out
to be likely to have difficulty doing sth

data.chText: 你九点钟前赶到那里可不容易。
data.enText: You'll have your work cut out to get there by nine o'clock.
in the works

data.chText: 在讨论（或计划、筹备等）中；在酝酿中
data.enText: something that is in the works is being discussed, planned or prepared and will happen or exist soon
the work of a moment, second, etc.
a thing that takes a very short time to do
all in a day's work

data.chText: 日常工作的一部分；习以为常；不足为奇
data.enText: part of your normal working life and not unusual
the devil makes work for idle hands
people who do not have enough to do often start to do wrong

data.chText: 她认为那些违法行为是当地的无业青少年所为，总是说：“人一闲，惹麻烦”。
data.enText: She blamed the crimes on the local jobless teenagers. ‘The devil makes work for idle hands,’ she would say.
(do sb's) dirty work

data.chText: （干）没人愿干的事，卑鄙的勾当
data.enText: (to do) the unpleasant or dishonest jobs that sb else does not want to do
many hands make light work

data.chText: 人多好办事；众人拾柴火焰高
data.enText: used to say that a job is made easier if a lot of people help
make hard work of sth

data.chText: 在某事上耗费过多时间（或精力）；费冤枉力
data.enText: to use more time or energy on a task than is necessary
a job of work

data.chText: 分内的事；必须干的工作

data.enText: or
work that you are paid to do or that must be done

data.chText: 有一件他不想干但又必须完成的工作在等待着他。
data.enText: There was a job of work waiting for him that he was not looking forward to.
make light work of sth
to do sth quickly and with little effort
a nasty piece of work

data.chText: 恶棍；令人讨厌的人；靠不住的人
data.enText: a person who is unpleasant, unkind or dishonest
nice work!
used to show you are pleased when sb has done sth well

data.chText: 你今天干得不错。好样的，詹姆斯！
data.enText: You did a good job today. Nice work, James!
make short work of sth/sb

data.chText: 干净利落地打败（或处理）；三下五除二就打垮（或解决）
data.enText: to defeat, deal with sth/sb quickly

data.chText: 利物浦队干净利落地击败了对手。
data.enText: Liverpool made short work of the opposition (= in a football/ soccer game) .
He made short work of his lunch (= ate it quickly) .
(throw) a spanner in the works
(throw) a (monkey) wrench in the works
(to cause) a delay or problem with sth that sb is planning or doing

data.text: work ♦ employment ♦ career ♦ profession ♦ occupation ♦ trade

data.chText: 以上各词均指有报酬的工作，尤指长期从事的职业。
data.enText: These are all words for the work that sb does in return for payment, especially over a long period of time.
work
the job that sb does, especially in order to earn money
It's very difficult to find work at the moment.
employment
( rather formal ) work, especially when it is done to earn money; the state of being employed or the situation in which people have work

data.chText: 这儿只有一半的人有拿工资的工作。
data.enText: Only half the people here are in paid employment.
career
the job or series of jobs that sb has in a particular area of work, usually involving more responsibility as time passes

data.chText: 他在外交部有过一段光辉的事业。
data.enText: He had a very distinguished career in the Foreign Office.
profession

data.chText: 指需要专门技能（尤其是较高教育水平）的职业、专业：
data.enText: a type of job that needs special training or skill, especially one that needs a high level of education

data.chText: 他希望能从事医务工作。
data.enText: He hopes to enter the medical profession.

data.chText: the profession统称某专业的人、同行、同业：
data.enText: The profession is all the people who work in a particular profession.
the legal profession

data.chText: the professions统称需要较高教育水平的传统职业，如医生、律师等。
data.enText: The professions are the traditional jobs that need a high level of education and training, such as being a doctor or lawyer.
occupation
( rather formal ) a job or profession

data.chText: 请写明姓名、年龄和职业。
data.enText: Please state your name, age, and occupation.
trade

data.chText: 指行业，尤指手工职业、手艺、行当：
data.enText: a job, especially one that involves working with your hands and requires special training and skills

data.chText: 木工是需要纯熟技巧的职业。
data.enText: Carpentry is a highly skilled trade.
in/out of work/employment
(a) full-time/part-time work/employment/career/profession/occupation
permanent/temporary work/employment
(a) well-paid/low-paid work/employment/profession/occupation
(a) paid/salaried/freelance/voluntary work/employment/occupation
(a/an/the) medical/legal/acting/teaching work/career/profession
to look for/seek/find work/employment/a career/an occupation
to get/obtain/give sb/offer sb/create/generate/provide work/employment

means: 工作所需的材料（或档案等）

ex.chText: 我们的工作多得做不完。
ex.enText: We have more work than we can deal with.

ex.chText: 工作能给人带来快乐。
ex.enText: Work can bring you pleasure.

ex.chText: 他15岁就开始工作了。
ex.enText: He started work when he was just 15.

ex.chText: 只有热爱工作的人才能享受到工作中的乐趣。
ex.enText: Only those who love their work can enjoy the delight in work.

synonyms.bx: 最普通用词，含义广泛，既可指体力劳动也可指脑力劳动，通常都以挣钱为目的，有时也指机器干的工作。

ex.chText: 彼得给邻居们打零工。
ex.enText: Peter does odd jobs for his neighbours.

ex.chText: 整理这些报告是件很辛苦的事。
ex.enText: Sorting these reports out is going to be a hard job.

ex.chText: 她女儿在银行里有份工作。
ex.enText: Her daughter has a job in a bank.

ex.chText: 这项工作要付出很多艰苦的劳动。
ex.enText: The job requires much hard labour.

synonyms.bx: 多用于口语，侧重指受雇用的、以谋生为目的的工作。

ex.chText: 一切财富归根到底来源于人类的劳动。
ex.enText: All wealth comes ultimately from human labour.

ex.chText: 蚂蚁间有明确的分工。
ex.enText: There is a clear division of labour in ants.

ex.chText: 他以他辛苦的劳动换取食物和栖身之所。
ex.enText: In return for his labour, he receives food and shelter.

ex.chText: 劳苦的一生通常是声望和成功的代价。
ex.enText: A life of toil is generally the price of fame and success.

ex.chText: 我无可奉献，除了鲜血、辛劳、泪水和汗水。
ex.enText: I have nothing to offer but blood, toil, tears and sweat.

ex.chText: 他教我如何使用计算机。
ex.enText: He taught me how to operate a computer.

ex.chText: 机器运转正常。
ex.enText: The machine operates well.

synonyms.bx: 指人操控机器或设备，也指机器等运行。

ex.chText: 供水系统有点问题。
ex.enText: The water system is not functioning well.

ex.chText: 尽管供电中断，医院继续照常运作。
ex.enText: Despite the power outage, the hospital continued to function normally.

ex.chText: 他早上不喝杯咖啡就无法工作。
ex.enText: He can't function without a coffee in the morning.

synonyms.bx: 指系统、机器设备、机构、人等正常工作。

ex.chText: 她没法让空调工作起来。
ex.enText: She couldn't get the air conditioner going.

ex.chText: 我的表不走了。
ex.enText: My watch isn't going.

synonyms.bx: 指机器、装置等工作，多用于口语。

ex.chText: 他的货车用的是柴油。
ex.enText: His van runs on diesel.

ex.chText: 别让发动机熄火。
ex.enText: Keep the engine running.

ex.chText: 这个软件在任何电脑上都能运行吗？
ex.enText: Will the software run on any computer?

synonyms.bx: 指机器、引擎等工作或使其开动，也指计算机程序运行或使其运行。

ex.chText: 链锯坏了。
ex.enText: The chainsaw doesn't work.

ex.chText: 钟走得很正常。
ex.enText: The clock is working properly.

ex.chText: 那个小男孩甚至连录像机都会用。
ex.enText: That little boy can even work the video.

synonyms.bx: 普通用词，指机器或设备正常工作，也可指使用机器或设备。

data.chText: 大多数含 work 的习语，都可在该等习语中的名词及形容词相关词条找到，如 work your fingers to the bone 在词条 finger 下。
data.enText: Most idioms containing work are at the entries for the nouns and adjectives in the idioms, for example work your fingers to the bone is at finger .
work it/things
to arrange sth in a particular way, especially by being clever

data.chText: 你能不能为我们搞到些免费票？
data.enText: Can you work it so that we get free tickets?
all work and no play (makes Jack a dull boy)

data.chText: 只工作不玩耍，聪明的孩子也变傻
data.enText: it is not healthy to spend all your time working; you need to relax too
at work
having an effect on sth

data.chText: 她怀疑有些秘密势力在作祟。
data.enText: She suspected that secret influences were at work.
busy doing sth
He is still at work on the painting.
Danger─men at work.
get (down) to/set to work
to begin; to make a start

data.chText: 我们从屋子的外部开始干了起来。
data.enText: We set to work on the outside of the house (= for example, painting it) .
give sb the works
to give or tell sb everything
good works
kind acts to help others
go/set about your work

data.chText: 做（或着手做）自己的工作
data.enText: to do/start to do your work

data.chText: 她高高兴兴地做自己的工作。
data.enText: She went cheerfully about her work.
have your work cut out
to be likely to have difficulty doing sth

data.chText: 你九点钟前赶到那里可不容易。
data.enText: You'll have your work cut out to get there by nine o'clock.
in the works

data.chText: 在讨论（或计划、筹备等）中；在酝酿中
data.enText: something that is in the works is being discussed, planned or prepared and will happen or exist soon
the work of a moment, second, etc.
a thing that takes a very short time to do
all in a day's work

data.chText: 日常工作的一部分；习以为常；不足为奇
data.enText: part of your normal working life and not unusual
the devil makes work for idle hands
people who do not have enough to do often start to do wrong

data.chText: 她认为那些违法行为是当地的无业青少年所为，总是说：“人一闲，惹麻烦”。
data.enText: She blamed the crimes on the local jobless teenagers. ‘The devil makes work for idle hands,’ she would say.
(do sb's) dirty work

data.chText: （干）没人愿干的事，卑鄙的勾当
data.enText: (to do) the unpleasant or dishonest jobs that sb else does not want to do
many hands make light work

data.chText: 人多好办事；众人拾柴火焰高
data.enText: used to say that a job is made easier if a lot of people help
make hard work of sth

data.chText: 在某事上耗费过多时间（或精力）；费冤枉力
data.enText: to use more time or energy on a task than is necessary
a job of work

data.chText: 分内的事；必须干的工作

data.enText: or
work that you are paid to do or that must be done

data.chText: 有一件他不想干但又必须完成的工作在等待着他。
data.enText: There was a job of work waiting for him that he was not looking forward to.
make light work of sth
to do sth quickly and with little effort
a nasty piece of work

data.chText: 恶棍；令人讨厌的人；靠不住的人
data.enText: a person who is unpleasant, unkind or dishonest
nice work!
used to show you are pleased when sb has done sth well

data.chText: 你今天干得不错。好样的，詹姆斯！
data.enText: You did a good job today. Nice work, James!
make short work of sth/sb

data.chText: 干净利落地打败（或处理）；三下五除二就打垮（或解决）
data.enText: to defeat, deal with sth/sb quickly

data.chText: 利物浦队干净利落地击败了对手。
data.enText: Liverpool made short work of the opposition (= in a football/ soccer game) .
He made short work of his lunch (= ate it quickly) .
(throw) a spanner in the works
(throw) a (monkey) wrench in the works
(to cause) a delay or problem with sth that sb is planning or doing
work around/round to sth/sb
to gradually turn a conversation towards a particular topic, subject, etc.

data.chText: 他东拉西扯了一会才绕到真正要说的事情上来。
data.enText: It was some time before he worked around to what he really wanted to say.
work at sth
to make great efforts to achieve sth or do sth well
He's working at losing weight.

data.chText: 学弹钢琴不容易，你非得下功夫不可。
data.enText: Learning to play the piano isn't easy. You have to work at it .
work sth in
work sth into sth
to try to include sth

data.chText: 难道你就不能在讲话中再增加几句笑话吗？
data.enText: Can't you work a few more jokes into your speech?
to add one substance to another and mix them together
Gradually work in the butter.
work sth↔off
to get rid of sth, especially a strong feeling, by using physical effort
She worked off her anger by going for a walk.
to earn money in order to be able to pay a debt

data.chText: 他们有一大笔银行贷款需要偿还。
data.enText: They had a large bank loan to work off.
work on sb

data.chText: 努力说服（使某人答应或做某事）
data.enText: to try to persuade sb to agree to sth or to do sth

data.chText: 他还没说他会做这事，不过我正在设法说服他。
data.enText: He hasn't said he'll do it yet, but I'm working on him.
work on sth
to try hard to improve or achieve sth

data.chText: 你需要再加把劲改进发音。
data.enText: You need to work on your pronunciation a bit more.

data.chText: “你找到临时看孩子的保姆了吗？”“还没有，我正在找呢。”
data.enText: ‘Have you sorted out a babysitter yet?’ ‘No, but I'm working on it .’
work out
to train the body by physical exercise

data.chText: 我经常做运动以保持健康。
data.enText: I work out regularly to keep fit.
to develop in a successful way

data.chText: 我的第一份工作干得不好。
data.enText: My first job didn't work out.

data.chText: 事情的结果对我们很不错。
data.enText: Things have worked out quite well for us.
work out (at sth)
if sth works out at sth, you calculate that it will be a particular amount

data.chText: 算来还是乘公共汽车便宜些。
data.enText: It'll work out cheaper to travel by bus.
work sb↔out
to understand sb's character

data.chText: 我从未能摸准她的秉性。
data.enText: I've never been able to work her out.
work sth↔out
to calculate sth
to work out the answer
to find the answer to sth
to work out a problem

data.chText: 你能辨认出这些潦草的字迹是什么意思吗？
data.enText: Can you work out what these squiggles mean?

data.chText: 我弄不清这音乐是从哪里传来的。
data.enText: I couldn't work out where the music was coming from.
to plan or think of sth

data.chText: 我想出了做这事的一个新方法。
data.enText: I've worked out a new way of doing it.
to remove all the coal, minerals, etc. from a mine over a period of time
a worked-out silver mine
work sb↔over
to attack sb and hit them, for example to make them give you information
work to sth

data.chText: 按照（计划、时间表等）；根据…行事
data.enText: to follow a plan, schedule, etc.
to work to a budget
We're working to a very tight deadline (= we have little time in which to do the work) .
work towards sth

data.chText: 努力达到，设法完成（目标）
data.enText: to try to reach or achieve a goal
work sth↔up
to develop or improve sth with some effort

data.chText: 我对他的想法怎么也热心不起来。
data.enText: I can't work up any enthusiasm for his idea.

data.chText: 她为了增加食欲散了很长时间的步。
data.enText: She went for a long walk to work up an appetite.
work sb/yourself up (into sth)
to make sb/yourself reach a state of great excitement, anger, etc.

data.chText: 别为此大动肝火。这不值得。
data.enText: Don't work yourself up into a state about it. It isn't worth it.

data.chText: 什么事使得你这么激动？
data.enText: What are you so worked up about?
work sth up into sth
to bring sth to a more complete or more acceptable state

data.chText: 我正在把我的笔记整理成一篇论文。
data.enText: I'm working my notes up into a dissertation.
work up to sth

data.chText: 逐步发展到，逐渐达到（更高或更深的程度）
data.enText: to develop or move gradually towards sth, usually sth more exciting or extreme

data.chText: 乐曲渐变到一个激动人心的末乐章。
data.enText: The music worked up to a rousing finale.

data.chText: 我开始在公园里慢跑，后来逐渐增加到一天跑五英里。
data.enText: I began by jogging in the park and worked up to running five miles a day.

trans: （通过消耗体力）宣泄（愤怒），释放（精力），排解（压力）
想出，得到（解决方法）；解（谜）
计算出，解出（数学题答案）
继续（服役）至期满；干满（离职通知规定的时间）
使（自己）心烦意乱（或气愤）

tr: activity directed toward making or doing something
example: she checked several points needing further work

tr: the occupation for which you are paid
example: he is looking for employment
a lot of people are out of work

tr: the total output of a writer or artist (or a substantial part of it)
example: he studied the entire Wagnerian oeuvre
Picasso's work can be divided into periods

tr: a product produced or accomplished through the effort or activity or agency of a person or thing
example: it is not regarded as one of his more memorable works
the symphony was hailed as an ingenious work
he was indebted to the pioneering work of John Dewey
the work of an active imagination
erosion is the work of wind or water over time

tr: a place where work is done
example: he arrived at work early today

tr: applying the mind to learning and understanding a subject (especially by reading)
example: mastering a second language requires a lot of work
no schools offer graduate study in interior design

tr: (physics) a manifestation of energy
the transfer of energy from one physical system to another expressed as the product of a force and the distance through which it moves a body in the direction of that force
example: work equals force times distance

tr: give a workout to
example: Some parents exercise their infants
My personal trainer works me hard
work one's muscles
this puzzle will exercise your mind

tr: arrive at a certain condition through repeated motion
example: The stitches of the hem worked loose after she wore the skirt many times

tr: go sour or spoil
example: The milk has soured
The wine worked
The cream has turned--we have to throw it out

tr: cause to undergo fermentation
example: We ferment the grapes for a very long time to achieve high alcohol content
The vintner worked the wine in big oak vats

tr: find the solution to (a problem or question) or understand the meaning of
example: did you solve the problem?
Work out your problems with the boss
this unpleasant situation isn't going to work itself out
did you get it?
Did you get my meaning?
He could not work the math problem

tr: use or manipulate to one's advantage
example: He exploit the new taxation system
She knows how to work the system
he works his parents for sympathy

tr: make uniform
example: knead dough
work the clay until it is soft

tr: perform as expected when applied
example: The washing machine won't go unless it's plugged in
Does this old car still run well?
This old radio doesn't work anymore

tr: move into or onto
example: work the raisins into the dough
the student worked a few jokes into his presentation
work the body onto the flatbed truck

tr: cause to happen or to occur as a consequence
example: I cannot work a miracle
wreak havoc
bring comments
play a joke
The rain brought relief to the drought-stricken area

tr: make something, usually for a specific function
example: She molded the rice balls carefully
Form cylinders from the dough
shape a figure
Work the metal into a sword

tr: shape, form, or improve a material
example: work stone into tools
process iron
work the metal

tr: prepare for crops
example: Work the soil
cultivate the land

tr: gratify and charm, usually in order to influence
example: the political candidate worked the crowds

tr: move in an agitated manner
example: His fingers worked with tension

tr: proceed along a path
example: work one's way through the crowd
make one's way into the forest

tr: provoke or excite
example: The rock musician worked the crowd of young girls into a frenzy

tr: proceed towards a goal or along a path or through an activity
example: work your way through every problem or task
She was working on her second martini when the guests arrived
Start from the bottom and work towards the top

tr: cause to work
example: he is working his servants hard

tr: be employed
example: Is your husband working again?
My wife never worked
Do you want to work after the age of 60?
She never did any work because she inherited a lot of money
She works as a waitress to put herself through college

tr: exert oneself by doing mental or physical work for a purpose or out of necessity
example: I will work hard to improve my grades
she worked hard for better living conditions for the poor

tr: cause to operate or function
example: This pilot works the controls
Can you work an electric drill?

tr: operate in or through
example: Work the phones

tr: have an effect or outcome
often the one desired or expected
example: The voting process doesn't work as well as people thought
How does your idea work in practice?
This method doesn't work
The breaks of my new car act quickly
The medicine works only if you take it with a lot of water

tr: have and exert influence or effect
example: The artist's work influenced the young painter
She worked on her friends to support the political candidate

tr: operate in a certain place, area, or specialty
example: She works the night clubs
The salesman works the Midwest
This artist works mostly in acrylics

tr: behave in a certain way when handled
example: This dough does not work easily
The soft metal works well

value.def: People who work have a job, usually one which they are paid to do.

example.ex: Weiner works for the US Department of Transport...
example.tran: 韦纳就职于美国交通部。

example.ex: I started working in a recording studio...
example.tran: 我开始在一个录音棚工作。

example.ex: Where do you work?...
example.tran: 你在哪儿工作？

example.ex: He worked as a bricklayer's mate...
example.tran: 他给瓦工打下手。

example.ex: I want to work, I don't want to be on welfare.
example.tran: 我想去工作，不想吃救济。

value.def: People who have work or who are in work have a job, usually one which they are paid to do.

example.ex: Fewer and fewer people are in work...
example.tran: 就业人数越来越少。

example.ex: I was out of work at the time...
example.tran: 那时我失业了。

example.ex: She'd have enough money to provide for her children until she could find work...
example.tran: 她在找到工作前应该有足够的钱供养孩子。

example.ex: What kind of work do you do?
example.tran: 你是做什么工作的？

value.def: When you work, you do the things that you are paid or required to do in your job.

example.ex: I can't talk to you right now—I'm working...
example.tran: 这会儿我不能跟你说话——我在干活儿。

example.ex: He was working at his desk...
example.tran: 他正在桌前用功。

example.ex: Some firms expect the guards to work twelve hours a day.
example.tran: 有些公司要求保安每天工作12小时。

value.boxu_tran: 动词 work 用于进行时和一般时时意义不同。用于进行时表示工作是临时性的，例如，I'm working in London (我目前在伦敦工作)暗示这种情形是暂时的，可能很快就会迁移到另一个地方。用于一般时则表示工作是固定的，例如，I work in London (我在伦敦工作)，暗示伦敦是固定的工作地点。
value.boxu_usage: The verb work has a different meaning in the continuous tenses than it does in the simple tenses. You use the continuous tenses, with the '-ing' form, to talk about a temporary job, but the simple tenses to talk about a permanent job. For example, if you say 'I'm working in London', this suggests that the situation is temporary and you may soon move to a different place. If you say 'I work in London', this suggests that London is your permanent place of work.

value.def: Your work consists of the things you are paid or required to do in your job.

example.ex: We're supposed to be running a business here. I've got work to do...
example.tran: 我们在这里应该是要经营公司。我有一堆的事情要做。

example.ex: I used to take work home, but I don't do it any more...
example.tran: 我过去常把活儿带回家干，不过我如今再也不这么做了。

example.ex: There have been days when I have finished work at 2pm.
example.tran: 有一段时间我凌晨两点才干完活儿。

example.ex: ...an image of teaching which highlighted the stressful and difficult aspects of the teacher's work.
example.tran: 突出显示了教师工作的压力和困难的教学场景

value.def: When you work, you spend time and effort doing a task that needs to be done or trying to achieve something.

example.ex: Linda spends all her time working on the garden...
example.tran: 琳达把所有时间都花在打理花园上。

example.ex: While I was working on my letter the telephone rang...
example.tran: 我正在写信，电话铃响了。

example.ex: Leonard was working at his German. His mistakes made her laugh...
example.tran: 伦纳德正在学习德语，他出的洋相让她哈哈大笑。

example.ex: The most important reason for coming to university is to work for a degree...
example.tran: 上大学最重要的原因就是要拿个学位。

example.ex: The government expressed hope that all the sides will work towards a political solution.
example.tran: 政府表示希望各方共同努力，制订出政治解决方案。

example.ex: There was a lot of work to do on their house...
example.tran: 他们的房子有很多地方需要收拾。

example.ex: We hadn't appreciated how much work was involved in organizing a wedding...
example.tran: 我们没有意识到筹备婚礼有多少事情要做。

example.ex: He said that the peace plan would be rejected because it needed more work.
example.tran: 他说和平计划会被否决，因为还需要进一步修改。

gramarinfo.label: with supp, usu poss N, N <l>with/among</l> n

value.def: Work is the place where you do your job.

example.ex: Many people travel to work by car...
example.tran: 很多人开车去上班。

example.ex: She told her friends at work that she was trying to lose weight.
example.tran: 她跟单位的朋友说她在努力减肥。

value.def: Work is something which you produce as a result of an activity or as a result of doing your job.

example.ex: It can help to have an impartial third party look over your work...
example.tran: 让客观公正的第三方看一下你的成果会有助益。

example.ex: Tidiness in the workshop is really essential for producing good work...
example.tran: 工作间干净整洁对于生产出好的产品非常重要。

example.ex: That's a beautiful piece of work. You should be proud of it.
example.tran: 那件作品非常漂亮，你应当为之自豪。

value.def: A work is something such as a painting, book, or piece of music produced by an artist, writer, or composer.

example.ex: In my opinion, this is Rembrandt's greatest work...
example.tran: 我认为这是伦勃朗最伟大的作品。

example.ex: Under his arm, there was a book which looked like the complete works of Shakespeare...
example.tran: 他胳膊底下夹着一本书，看上去就像是夹了《莎士比亚全集》。

example.ex: The church has several valuable works of art.
example.tran: 教堂有几件珍贵的艺术品。

value.tran: (艺术家、作家、作曲家等的)作品；著作

value.def: If someone is working on a particular subject or question, they are studying or researching it.

example.ex: Professor Bonnet has been working for many years on molecules of this type.
example.tran: 邦尼特教授多年来一直在从事这种分子的研究工作。

example.ex: Their work shows that one-year-olds are much more likely to have allergies if either parent smokes.
example.tran: 他们的研究表明，如果父母中有一人吸烟，一岁婴儿患过敏的可能性就会大大增加。

value.def: If you work with a person or a group of people, you spend time and effort trying to help them in some way.

example.ex: She spent a period of time working with people dying of cancer...
example.tran: 她有一段时间曾帮助垂危的癌症患者。

example.ex: He knew then that he wanted to work among the poor.
example.tran: 他那时明白了自己想帮助穷人。

example.ex: ...a highly respected priest who is noted for his work with the poor...
example.tran: 以救助穷人闻名的备受尊敬的教士

example.ex: She became involved in social and relief work among the refugees.
example.tran: 她参加了帮助难民的社会救济工作。

value.def: If a machine or piece of equipment works, it operates and performs a particular function.

example.ex: The pump doesn't work and we have no running water...
example.tran: 水泵坏了，我们没有自来水了。

example.ex: Is the telephone working today?...
example.tran: 电话今天能用吗？

example.ex: Ned turned on the lanterns, which worked with batteries...
example.tran: 内德打开开关亮起了装电池的灯笼。

example.ex: How does the gun work?
example.tran: 这枪怎么用?

value.def: If an idea, system, or way of doing something works, it is successful, effective, or satisfactory.

example.ex: 95 per cent of these diets do not work...
example.tran: 这些节食方法95%都不起作用。

example.ex: If lust is all there is to hold you together, the relationship will never work...
example.tran: 如果肉欲是你们在一起的唯一理由，这种关系是不会持久的。

example.ex: I shouldn't have come, I knew it wouldn't work...
example.tran: 我不应该来，我知道这起不了什么作用。

example.ex: A methodical approach works best.
example.tran: 有条不紊的方法效果最佳。

value.def: If a drug or medicine works, it produces a particular physical effect.

example.ex: I wake at 6 am as the sleeping pill doesn't work for more than nine hours...
example.tran: 安眠药的药效不会超过9个小时，所以我清晨6点就醒了。

example.ex: The drug works by increasing levels of serotonin in the brain.
example.tran: 这种药物通过提高大脑中血清素的含量来产生疗效。

value.def: If something works in your favour, it helps you in some way. If something works to your disadvantage, it causes problems for you in some way.

example.ex: One factor thought to have worked in his favour is his working class image...
example.tran: 据认为，一个帮上了他的因素就是他的工人阶级形象。

example.ex: This obviously works against the interests of the child.
example.tran: 这显然会对孩子不利。

value.tran: 产生(有利或不利的)影响

value.def: If something or someone works their magic or works their charms on a person, they have a powerful positive effect on them.

example.ex: Nevertheless, she is always optimistic about the possibilities and can work her charm on the disenchanted...
example.tran: 虽然如此，她总是乐观地抱持希望，并能深深地感染那些心灰意冷的人。

example.ex: Our spirits rallied as the bitter-sweet alcohol worked its magic.
example.tran: 苦中带甜的酒发挥了奇效，我们的精神随之振奋起来。

value.tran: 对…产生(神奇的影响);使…深受（魅力感染）

value.def: If your mind or brain is working, you are thinking about something or trying to solve a problem.

example.ex: My mind was working frantically, running over the events of the evening.
example.tran: 我的大脑疯狂地运转，把那晚发生的事情飞快地一幕幕重演。

value.def: If you work on an assumption or idea, you act as if it were true or base other ideas on it, until you have more information.

example.ex: We are working on the assumption that it was a gas explosion.
example.tran: 我们假设这是一场燃气爆炸事故。

value.tran: 以(某种假定或思想)为基础(或前提)

value.def: If you work a particular area or type of place, you travel around that area or work in those places as part of your job, for example trying to sell something there.

example.ex: Brand has been working the clubs and the pubs since 1986, developing her comedy act...
example.tran: 布兰德自1986年以来一直在俱乐部和酒吧表演，提高她的喜剧演技。

example.ex: This is the seventh year that he has worked the streets of Manhattan.
example.tran: 这是他在曼哈顿街头献艺的第7个年头。

value.tran: 在(某地或某类场所)工作;在…奔波

value.def: If you work someone, you make them spend time and effort doing a particular activity or job.

example.ex: They're working me too hard. I'm too old for this...
example.tran: 他们把我用得太狠了，我老了，干不了这种活儿啦。

example.ex: They didn't take my father away, but kept him in the village and worked him to death.
example.tran: 他们没有把我爸爸带走，而是一直让他在村里干活，把他活活累死了。

value.def: If someone, often a politician or entertainer, works a crowd, they create a good relationship with the people in the crowd and get their support or interest.

example.ex: The Prime Minister has an ability to work a crowd — some might even suggest it is a kind of charm...
example.tran: 首相有种感召人群的本事——有些人甚至认为这是一种魅力。

example.ex: He worked the room like a politician, gripping hands, and slapping backs.
example.tran: 他又是握手，又是拍背，像个政客一样把一屋子的人都笼络了一番。

value.tran: (常指政客或艺人)博得，赢得(众人的支持或欢心)

value.def: When people work the land, they do all the tasks involved in growing crops.

example.ex: Farmers worked the fertile valleys.
example.tran: 农民们在肥沃的山谷里耕种。

value.def: When a mine is worked, minerals such as coal or gold are removed from it.

example.ex: The mines had first been worked in 1849, when gold was discovered in California...
example.tran: 1849年加利福尼亚发现金矿时，这些矿第一次被开采。

example.ex: Only an agreed number of men was allowed to work any given seam at any given time.
example.tran: 只有少数得到批准的人可以在特定时间开采特定的矿层。

value.def: If you work a machine or piece of equipment, you use or control it.

example.ex: Many adults still depend on their children to work the video.
example.tran: 很多成年人仍然要靠孩子来操作录像机。

value.def: If something works into a particular state or condition, it gradually moves so that it is in that state or condition.

example.ex: A screw had worked loose from my glasses.
example.tran: 我眼镜上有一个螺丝松了。

value.def: If you work a substance such as dough or clay, you keep pressing it to make it have a particular texture.

example.ex: Work the dough with the palm of your hand until it is very smooth...
example.tran: 用手掌将面团揉至光滑为止。

example.ex: Remove rind from the cheese and work it to a firm paste, with a fork.
example.tran: 将奶酪的外皮去掉，用叉子将其压成硬硬的膏状。

value.def: If you work a material such as metal, leather, or stone, you cut, sew, or shape it in order to make something or to create a design.

example.ex: ...the machines needed to extract and work the raw stone.
example.tran: 开采加工原石的机器

example.ex: ...a long, cool tunnel of worked stone.
example.tran: 一条跨度长且阴凉的石凿隧道

value.def: If you work with a particular substance or material, you use it in order to make something or to create a design.

example.ex: He studied sculpture because he enjoyed working with clay.
example.tran: 他学习雕塑是因为他喜欢玩黏土。

value.tran: 使用，采用(某种材料或物质)

value.def: If you work a part of your body, or if it works, you move it.

example.ex: Each position will work the muscles in a different way...
example.tran: 每种姿势都会以不同方式活动肌肉。

example.ex: Her mouth was working in her sleep.
example.tran: 她睡着的时候嘴巴还在动。

value.def: A works is a place where something is manufactured or where an industrial process is carried out. Works is used to refer to one or to more than one of these places.

example.ex: The steel works could be seen for miles.
example.tran: 这个钢厂几英里外都能看见。

example.ex: ...a recycling works.
example.tran: 回收工厂

example.ex: ...the works canteen.
example.tran: 工厂餐厅

value.def: Works are activities such as digging the ground or building on a large scale.

example.ex: ...six years of disruptive building works, road construction and urban development.
example.tran: 6年间进行的破坏性的建筑工程、道路修筑和城市扩建

value.def: You can say the works after listing things such as someone's possessions or requirements, to emphasize that they possess or require everything you can think of in a particular category.

example.ex: Amazing place he's got there—squash courts, swimming pool, jacuzzi, the works.
example.tran: 他的那个地方真是太棒了——壁球场、游泳池、按摩浴池，一应俱全。

value.tran: (某种类型的)全部物件，全套物品

value.def: If someone is at work they are doing their job or are busy doing a particular activity.

example.ex: The salvage teams are already hard at work trying to deal with the spilled oil...
example.tran: 救援队已经在紧张地设法处理溢出的石油。

example.ex: He is currently at work on a novel...
example.tran: 他这会儿正忙着写一篇小说。

example.ex: Television cameras were invited in to film him at work.
example.tran: 电视台摄像师被请进来拍摄他工作的镜头。

value.tran: 干活儿;做工作;忙着做事

value.def: If a force or process is at work, it is having a particular influence or effect.

example.ex: The report suggested that the same trend was at work in politics...
example.tran: 这份报告表明，同一趋势也在影响着政治。

example.ex: It is important to understand the powerful economic and social forces at work behind our own actions.
example.tran: 重要的是，要理解在我们自身行动背后起作用的强大的经济和社会力量。

value.def: If you say that you will have your work cut out to do something, you mean that it will be a very difficult task.

example.ex: The new administration has its work cut out for it. Creating jobs in this kind of environment is not going to be easy...
example.tran: 新一届政府面临重重困难。在这种环境下创造就业机会绝非易事。

example.ex: He will have his work cut out to get into the team.
example.tran: 他要进入该队困难重重。

gramarinfo.label: V inflects, oft PHR <l>for</l> n, PHR to-inf

value.def: If something is in the works, it has already been planned or begun.

example.ex: He said there were dozens of economic plans in the works...
example.tran: 他说有几十项经济计划已经开始实施。

example.ex: Nobody should be surprised by this. It's been in the works for some time.
example.tran: 不应该有人对此感到惊奇，这事已经张罗了有一阵子了。

value.boxr_value: in BRIT, usually use 英国英语通常用 in the pipeline

value.def: You can use work to talk about how easily or quickly a particular task is done. For example, if a person or thing makes short work of doing something or makes light work of it, they do it quickly and easily.

example.ex: An aerosol spray will make short work of painting awkward objects...
example.tran: 用喷罐来喷涂，不好对付的物品也能轻松搞定。

example.ex: This horse made light work of the cross-country course...
example.tran: 这匹马轻松地跑完了越野赛程。

example.ex: Australia made hard work of beating them.
example.tran: 澳大利亚队非常艰难地击败了他们。

value.def: If you describe someone as a nasty piece of work, you think they are very unpleasant or cruel.

example.ex: Underneath I think he's actually a rather nasty piece of work.
example.tran: 内心里我觉得他是个非常讨厌的家伙。

value.def: If you put someone to work or set them to work, you give them a job or task to do.

example.ex: By stimulating the economy, we're going to put people to work...
example.tran: 我们将通过刺激经济让人们实现就业。

example.ex: Instead of sending them to prison, we have set them to work helping the lemon growers.
example.tran: 我们没有把他们送进监狱，而是让他们帮种柠檬的果农干活儿。

gramarinfo.label: V inflects, oft PHR prep, PHR -ing

value.def: If you get to work ,go to work, or set to work on a job, task, or problem, you start doing it or dealing with it.

example.ex: He promised to get to work on the state's massive deficit...
example.tran: 他承诺着手解决国家庞大的财政赤字问题。

example.ex: He returned to America where he set to work on a new novel.
example.tran: 他返回美国，开始写一部新小说。

value.def: If you work your way somewhere, you move or progress there slowly, and with a lot of effort or work.

example.ex: Rescuers were still working their way towards the trapped men...
example.tran: 营救人员仍在艰难地向被困者靠拢。

example.ex: Many personnel managers started as secretaries or personnel assistants and worked their way up.
example.tran: 很多人事经理最初是从秘书或人事助理做起，然后慢慢升上去的。

value.tran: 艰难地移动；缓慢地取得进展

value.def: You can say to someone 'nice work' or 'good work' in order to thank or praise them for doing something well or quickly.

example.ex: Nice work, Matthew. I knew you could do it.
example.tran: 干得好，马修。我知道你能行。

xrse.def: to throw a spanner in the works

trans: 干活儿;做工作;忙着做事；起作用;发挥效用
锻炼；想出，得到（解决方法）；解（谜）；计算出，解出（数学题答案）；计算下来（为）；（如期）发生；进展（顺利）；圆满结束；完成；继续（服役）至期满；干满（离职通知规定的时间）；健身
